meanings.definition: In a false or deceitful manner
meanings.sent1: He spuriously claimed to have seen a UFO last night.
meanings.sent2: The witness spuriously testified in court to protect his friend.
meanings.sent3: The magician spuriously made the rabbit disappear, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was spuriously bright, hiding the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The salesman spuriously promised a lifetime guarantee, but the product broke after a week.

meanings.sent1: The art collector discovered the spuriously signed painting in his collection.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase turned out to be spuriously crafted, disappointing the buyer.
meanings.sent3: The designer handbag looked spuriously similar to the original, but the quality gave it away.
meanings.sent4: His spuriously polite demeanor masked his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The website sold spuriously branded items at a fraction of the cost.
